website_summaries.verdict: A versatile option that works for both frozen and baked shot glasses. Hands-down the best value for money.
pros: Can be used for ice, cookie dough, candies, chocolate, jello, and more
Owners praise the construction quality and ease of use
cons: Some owners report that cookie dough leaves a hard-to-remove oily residue

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mold. I used it for only one thing so far and that was to make jolly rancher glasses. I was using it to make a gift for someone who asked for candy so I thought this would be perfect and more creative than just regular candy.
customer_reviews.author: Aubs

customer_reviews.title: Great for chocolate.
customer_reviews.text: I used it make chocolate cups and they came out great. There is a trick to it, as you pour in the chocolate you should squeeze the mold to get out the bubbles. Make sure to pour into one cup at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Fun product to experiment with
customer_reviews.text: My first few attempts at using this involved jello shots, which I had difficulty getting out of the mold, so they ended up breaking apart. I've been told I need to spray some oil inside the molds and add more gelatin, so I will try that next time I attempt those. Meanwhile, I decided to make some hard candy glasses, which were very easy to make and remove from the mold. In the pictures you can see the three I made with Torie & Howard organic hard candy. Then I did some with Jolly Ranchers for those great colors. Very fun!!
customer_reviews.author: fenderhardt

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and cute!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my sister as a gift and have never seen her so actively use a present! She has made every kind of cup imaginable ranging from chocolate to caramel to jello. Personally, I don’t drink but this is also perfect for mini milk and cookie cups! Unfortunately, these are a tad bit difficult to clean, but overall worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Kai S.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I LOOOOVE this mold! It’s so easy. Didn’t come with instructions, but with everything on YouTube and Google, no problems. The first time I tried, I didn’t let it harden long enough. My mistake. This picture is the second try. The colored are jolly rancher. Baked on 350 for 20 min. Let sit out until it’s hard again, like the original form. The solid blue is isomalt. Not made in the oven, but heated up regularly and just poured in. Also let sit until hard. Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Elle Kadie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: My first epoxy mold worked out really well and came out easy. I put it in a different slot and tried to remove about n hour later and silicone was peeling off on my resin mold. Not sure if I just recieved a bad item but they all ripping and was a waste of my money. 3 resin molds got stuck leaving me no choice but to RIP to remove and it the silicone is still stuck.
customer_reviews.author: isaiah smith

customer_reviews.title: Will need to place on a sheet pan so it doesn't spill or dry uneven.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product today and I can't wait to try and make some glasses out of it. It isn't very sturdy so like with anything silicone you will probably want to place it on a sheet pan before placing in the freezer. Also, as I've read in other comments you will want to make sure you kind of bang it to get the chocolate to settle in and not leave open sections. I will update when I use this if I had any difficulties.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Jolly rancher shot glasses!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for my older brother. They worked perfect to make jolly rancher shot glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: THINK OF ALL THE FOOD CUPS YOU CAN MAKE
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. Period. We have made grilled cheese shot glasses filled with tomato soup. Chocolate shot glasses filled with strawberry mousse. Jolly rancher shot glasses filled with alcohol The possibilities with this mold are endless and tasty! Safe in the oven!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: High expectations to low results
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't have bought these had I known that they are pretty much useless. I used them for chocolate shot glasses. Although they were easy to make and kind of easy to get out, they are WAY too thick to really do anything with them. Eating them is near impossible unless you want to chip a tooth! That also causes the part to fill to be so small that you cant get much of anything in there. Also, it took a whole bag of chocolate melts to make only 5 shot classes. Not worth the money, time, and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Tim F.

customer_reviews.title: makes thick sturdy shot glasses
customer_reviews.text: still experimenting with these for uses other than ice if you want them to be edible, be aware the shot glasses come out very thick - especially the base when using chocolate or batter, be sure tap out the air thoroughly
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Love this mold!
customer_reviews.text: You can get really creative with this shot glass mold. I made chocolate glasses to start and they were super easy to do. I bought the "Wilton" chocolate wafers and was able to get about 6 glasses with a 12 oz. bag. I am going to fill these with a "Baileys" liquor ,chocolate mousse. I really want to try the jolly ranchers next. I put the mold in freezer for about 15 minutes and they came out very easily. These will be a hit for Christmas Day.
customer_reviews.author: CatrineTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Great but still
customer_reviews.text: This molds handles the oven, fridge or freezer no problem. Couple issues. Molds are very difficult to get the materials out once set. Usually requiring some sort of nonstick spray which can effect what you’re trying to do with it. Mold is also very flexible so any liquids you put in them be prepared to make a mess if you don’t hold it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you want to use resin!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product based off a couple of reviews which said it was great for making resin shot glasses. NO!!!! They all stuck to the silicone. Will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Mendy

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my absolute favorite product in the kitchen for hosting. So much fun and creative for desserts. I wish Wilton had a mini cookbook with it for more ideas but what I have done with it so far has been a huge hit.
customer_reviews.author: Buckwheat91

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use!!!! I use this product to make resin shot glasses and they turn out perfect every single time!! And this mold is really easy to clean. I just have a problem getting the glitter off but glitter is a nuisance
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as i wanted
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it more stars but the 1st time i used it cups came out great washed it and used it again and they came out funky washed it again made sure it was dry. Tried it again and same thing. Maybe its just me i dont know. I do know i wouldnt buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel r.

customer_reviews.title: Fun novelty
customer_reviews.text: Had a great time making Jolly Rancher shot glasses. The kids were impressed. The Starburst shot glasses were a fail for me but very pretty. They were just soft. Jolly Rancher shot glasses were pretty and fun. Great novelty item and conversation piece for a gathering.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Good for thick shot glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The resulting shot glass is very thick. I would prefer something a bit thinner. But it is a solid item
customer_reviews.author: T. McCann

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this mold! I have used it a few times already (to make cookie shot glasses). Works GREAT! I am looking forward to using this mold with jello. But so far this product is worth the $$ and I will be using often.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this to make Jell-O shot glasses, jolly rancher shot glasses and ice shot glasses. They are easy to remove and this thing works great in the oven for the jolly rancher glasses. Haven’t tried cookie dough shot glasses yet but I’m sure that’s next.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Kotten

customer_reviews.title: Good results
customer_reviews.text: I've seen other reviews that complained about how difficult it is to remove the cups from the mold. I heavily sprayed the mold with pan release before pouring the chocolate and the cups came out cleanly. Because the silicone is so thick it is a little hard to turn the cups out but it's not impossible. Overall I'm happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great for parties
customer_reviews.text: I host parties at my house a lot and let me tell you, the shot glasses I made with this was the talk of the night!!! I recommend using Starbursts or a candy with similar hardness. Anything softer, like skittles etc, will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea W

customer_reviews.title: worked fine
customer_reviews.text: Only have used these so far to make ice shot glasses. Only issue is the bottom is not as thick so it is harder to use the ice shot glass due to melting. But worked great
customer_reviews.author: W. Pampell

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Very soft material, had a hard time filling the water and transfer it into the fridge. It was also difficult to retrieve the ice mold when it was done. The center of the Silicon would get stuck inside. Had to run water through the outside of the mold to break it lose. But doing so causes the ice to melt partially already.
customer_reviews.author: Winster

customer_reviews.title: Works great for projects!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my resin projects. To make small shakers. Works very well. As for using it for ice shot glass well i never used it for that. But im pretty sure it would work well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: A. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Possibilities are endless...
customer_reviews.text: I have made brownies, caramels, starburst, ice pops, jolly ranchers, peppsrmints...and on and on. These are a lot of fun for both alchohol and non alcoholic dessert cups.
customer_reviews.author: MyraM

customer_reviews.title: Great mold
customer_reviews.text: This mold was fun to use. It takes quite a bit of resin to fill. The end result was not disappointing. They come out easily and it’s easy to clean. I now have some cute little shot glasses that I have no need for lol.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa willard

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ABSOLUTELY LUV these! I made jolly rancher shots in these and my friends and family fell in love! Now, every time we have a party I have to make shot glasses!!
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Disaster.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. I tried with ice and it worked, but the liquid very quickly and then it leaks. I tried with jello and it got stuck and was a disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Problematic in removal of anything gelatin. I had to make it "jiggler consistency" and then add an extra 2 tsp of gelatin powder to make it removable from the mold. Other items work well, but bottom is pretty darn think. Should probably rethink the design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for resin
customer_reviews.text: I don’t suggest using it for resin unless you have a really good mold release. Stuck to my creation and tore the mold when removing it :/
customer_reviews.author: Lee Richie

customer_reviews.title: NEXT LEVEL DRINKING GAMES
customer_reviews.text: Super easy and awesome fun. Have made several cinnamon shot glasses have been the hit of the drinking game. Absolutely easy clean up ready to experiment with many other candies.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to get anything out of the mold, especially if said material is fragile. It would be better if the bottoms of the cups came out a bit thicker.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and remove I use this to make shot glasses with epoxy cleaning it up isn’t the easiest but I love how they turn out
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Turner

customer_reviews.title: Fun "glass" alternative
customer_reviews.text: For ice shots, great. Chocolate shots, great. Bought to make candy cane shot glasses. Not the easiest to use, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jean S.

customer_reviews.title: Cute cute cute
customer_reviews.text: Its very easy to use ,just add the candies then put it in the oven.... Soooooo easy to take the candy glass shot out of the silicon. I made some to my neighbour today, she said she will invite some of her friends over to have a drink in those cute glass shot..... Thank you Wilton and amazon, for making me and my neighbors happy.
customer_reviews.author: The bread lady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Made candy shot glasses. Super easy to use. Mold is flexible so when i stuffed Jolly ranchers (about 13 each mold) they fit and melted perfectly. Was nervous send the silicon was stuffed the shape would be off but came out perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Kerron

customer_reviews.title: It was a decent value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make bath bombs I'm old is a bit hard to clean but other than that it does do the job
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Slippers Racing Stables

customer_reviews.title: Ice or jello perfect not for cookie shoots
customer_reviews.text: Used to bake cookie shoots ..... no problems to take it out but I didn’t like that no matter what you do always will form air bubbles and won’t make perfect shoot rims For ice or jello shoots is perfect 👌🏼
customer_reviews.author: Liliana Lomeli

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: First time using this and it came out better than expected. My client loved it! I made edible gelatine shot glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Karla

customer_reviews.title: Good molds but gets dirty easily
customer_reviews.text: I love these molds! I use them to make resin shot glasses for my Etsy shop @MagpiesWickedWonders. The only problem I have found with these is that EVERYTHING sticks to them. I was kind of expecting this but dust and dog/cat hair gets stuck to them very easily. That being said they are super easy to use and the projects are super easy to remove from this mold.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Pasour

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, just doesn't work as well as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I made gelatin "wiggler" cups, could get only 2 out of 8 out without tearing...I will try making crispy rice cups instead...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sad about it
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited until I made a shot glass and went to pull it out... Didn't have problems with the other glasses coming out then this. When I tr8ed to get the glass out, it was stuck to the mold and has now torn. Not cool. It comes with 8 holes, I am now only able to use 6.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Cottrell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic idea BUT there is a minor flaw
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic idea BUT there is a minor flaw. When liquor is poured in the ice cup the shot glass cracks. Luckily I put all the shots on a plate. When served they began leaking. Good news, it was party trick. Bad news, a complete mess. The $9 was worth a good laugh but will not be using again.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L.

customer_reviews.title: cant go wrong
customer_reviews.text: works well with hard candy. great gift idea. cheaper than bed bath and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: LBJ

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful mold
customer_reviews.text: I love this mold, you can use it for many desserts. I use it for jello shoots, for chocolate and like an ice cream cup.
customer_reviews.author: Graciela21

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Will be a major part of our new business offerings.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, works well with jolly ranchers and almond bark. Makes very thick cups though. Form is very easy to break cups out of after they are baked and cooled. The mold stained after several uses of jolly ranchers baked in the oven. Great product, I love using it! Would not recommend for jell-o.
customer_reviews.author: TeacherMama

customer_reviews.title: Love this easy mold.
customer_reviews.text: This is so cool. Super easy to use. I've tried water, Apple juice, candy and water, candy and apple juice and they were so good. My husband just ate the shot glass lol. I can't wait to try it with chocolate. Only challenge I had was trying to pull it out of the mold. Still came out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: DaraLovesCoupons

customer_reviews.title: Keep level
customer_reviews.text: Nice novelty item. Will be great with jagermeister. Many party applications for under & over 21. Cant wait to try making with pudding.
customer_reviews.author: lyn923

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!!
customer_reviews.text: My son purchased it to melt jolly ranchers into cups. Fun. Very durable
customer_reviews.author: Deidre

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are so fun! Great for parties. As a suggestion, when you take them from the mold, add a little more water on the bottom and re-freeze. Alcohol can warm it and leak out. But these are with it for the novelty.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Lynn

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: It broke already did not last and it is hard to get iut
customer_reviews.author: ECG Treasures

customer_reviews.title: A total success!!!
customer_reviews.text: My molds came in right on time. I did jolly ranchers and starbursts shot glasses and they were a total success. Everyone loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L Robles

customer_reviews.title: Works Grrrrreat!
customer_reviews.text: Works great...I used chocolate chip cookies for the outside and brownie for the inside. Just don't use Cannabutter you will eat them all. Cook the out side first lol I don't think you can cook both thing at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Buy
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with this Pay attention to it when using it
customer_reviews.author: Nesha simp

customer_reviews.title: This thing is dope!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it!!! I watched several YouTube videos for ideas. You can make shot glasses out of candies, cookie dough, ice, juice, chocolate. It's amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Banee

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: I have made chocolate shots and ice shots with these. Worked great for both. Highly recommend. Have not tried in oven. For ice this thing is super easy. And clean up is easy
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for New Years Eve. I made hard candy shot glasses by placing flavored hard candy inside the mold and melting them in the oven. It turned out very well and I really did not have any trouble taking them out of the mold.
customer_reviews.author: FlSun

customer_reviews.title: Jolly Rancher Shots, Y'all!!
customer_reviews.text: Stuff 'em in, bake at 350 for 10 minutes, let cool, pop 'em out, pour in some vodka, and CHEERS!!
customer_reviews.author: Chaunchy

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Party Desserts!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I did a New Years Day Champagne and Dessert Party. I made various cakes, pies, custard but wanted to do something "showy". I order these shot molds and they worked great. I used a Wilton recipe with chocolate wafers, and a cream cheese and raspberry filling. Great complements from all guests. I will be using them for ST. Patrick's with a Bailey's mouse!
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The mold was easy to work with. My guests loved how unique they were. Easy to clean, and store.
customer_reviews.author: tanika steele

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Tried my first ever, cherry/ watermelon hard canny shot glasses, they turned out great!
customer_reviews.author: MissJess

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! This worked great to make jolly rancher shot glasses for my daughter's 21st birthday. I sprayed it with non-stick coconut oil and the glasses came out perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality mold. Worked really well for both got and cold molds.
customer_reviews.author: Cerealympian

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Made some cookie and milk shots and they were awesome!!! Can't wait to try more stuff out.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I love marking jolly rancher shot glasses
customer_reviews.text: I love marking jolly rancher shot glasses. Everyone likes the taste and colors. But grape looks ugly, and now I have tons of grape and I hate grape.
customer_reviews.author: Trey Boles

customer_reviews.title: satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12yrs old, and it was all they say it is. She's loving ❤ and
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Peroune Harris

customer_reviews.title: Fun, guests loved it
customer_reviews.text: I used this to make shot glasses with jolly ranchers for Halloween. It was a huge hit, everyone loved it! It was very sticky and messy though. Probably a one time novelty item for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Made shot glasses with jolly ranchers for a party. They came out great and the guests loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Staci L Gainer

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: Super east to use. Have so many ideas what to do with these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Batovsky

customer_reviews.title: Too thick.
customer_reviews.text: For lemonchello cups. But they are too thick and too heavy. I used a whole bag of chocolate and only got 4 cups. Not what I expected
customer_reviews.author: pewaukee

customer_reviews.title: these are too large to be very useful. as ice
customer_reviews.text: these are too large to be very useful. as ice, it melts quickly and as chocolate is not really edible as it is so thick. Haven't tried baking something edible... I don't think it would be very easy to remove them in one piece... they turn inside out and stick to the inside of the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Carol in CO

customer_reviews.title: I like the product
customer_reviews.text: I like the product. The grape jolly ranchers left a weird brown stain on the top part of the mold. I find hard candies work much better than gummy candies (a disaster), Mike and Ike, or cinnamon candies (not the hard candy round discs). Easy to unmold the jolly rancher glasses after they had cooled.
customer_reviews.author: cenk

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: So easy and fun to use. The silicone is perfect for anything you put in and peel out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Danaka

customer_reviews.title: They are very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Are use it to make jolly rancher shots they worked out great but did get a little stain
customer_reviews.author: perla

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to make chocolate cups. Easy to use. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality mold
customer_reviews.text: Made jolly rancher shot glasses. This was a great mold. Cleaned readily, held up in heat and the candy came out of it without trouble
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I've used this many times with Jolly Ranchers, Gummy Bears and jello. These molds are awesome!! Me and my kids love them!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Chard

customer_reviews.title: User with jolly rancher candy to make candy shot glasses ...
customer_reviews.text: User with jolly rancher candy to make candy shot glasses. DELICIOUS 😋 & it was a hit at my party 🎉
customer_reviews.author: Buela

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! We made s bunch of different kinds for the Super Bowl & they were gone in a hurry!
customer_reviews.author: DSC44

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love it. Came super fast! Can’t wait to try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Nichoel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I used these to make jolly rancher shot glasses for a game night. It was perfect. I also made ice shot glasses, super fun and easy to clean and store. I had to put it in the oven and it worked just fine
customer_reviews.author: Tia M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for peppermint cups
customer_reviews.text: I used this handy item to make peppermint cups for the holidays. Sprayed with non-stick spray..and they turned out great..can't wait to make chocolate cups and other things. Fun and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: M B

customer_reviews.title: I like it and it's a cute idea for making jello ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it and it's a cute idea for making jello shot glasses to fill with whipped cream, fruits, pudding, etc. Great for parties. But the only problem is that it's hard to take the jello out of the mold.
customer_reviews.author: DNg

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE them. You can make all types of edible ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these and they didn't come so I ended up going to the store and purchasing them. I LOVE them.You can make all types of edible shot glasses with them AND they are so easy to clean. I love silicone because it doesn't melt or stain
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Watson

customer_reviews.title: Cool gift, great price
customer_reviews.text: Alot of fun Look up recipes to use, or videos, jolly ranchers worked the best.
customer_reviews.author: Annie M

customer_reviews.title: Very thick
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had chocolate shot glasses before that we’re much thinner. This mold makes very thick glasses that are difficult to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hewes

customer_reviews.title: how awesome is this?!?! way cool!
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome buy!!! Super impressed and can make all kinds of awesome shot glasses!! Jolly rancher ones, chocolate ones etc! So can go in the oven or freezer absolutely awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Harscher

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: Love! Love! Love! These! They were a big hit when i had them for my partners 50th bday party and have many more ideas to create different designs jolly ranchers and starbursts work best to start!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Recob

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: These mold are easy to use and very durable. I used them to make jolly rancher shot glasses
customer_reviews.author: Rosiland Hale

customer_reviews.title: ... as a gift for a friend and they were super excited about
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used these but i bought it as a gift for a friend and they were super excited about it
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: I got more than I needed and I’m happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Candy Shot Glasses
customer_reviews.text: We already made shot glasses from a big bag of Jolly Rancher candy we got at Walmart. Someone showed me a picture of an inventive idea to use the red and white peppermint candy that looked cool, we will try those next.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great for candy shot glasses
customer_reviews.text: Great product! We made Werther's candy shot glasses with this for Halloween and we definitely weren't disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: S & S

customer_reviews.title: Twist it.!
customer_reviews.text: Makes great shot glass or dappen dishes.! It is a little hard to remove from mold, but if you twist while pulling, it comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Bria Bell

customer_reviews.title: Cool Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Unfortunately I have not had a chance to use them. I already have a lot of ideas for use of this product. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Beauty

customer_reviews.title: Great mold, will be buying more
customer_reviews.text: This mold is great! This was my first time doing resin and the shot glasses came out great. Something to note: the mold holds 2 ounces of resin. The finished product will hold 1 oz of liquid when filled to the brim. I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: DaniLee Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Quality price
customer_reviews.text: Have only made ice with it so far and it was ok. They had bumps when I removed them, but that may have been an op error. Wilton makes good stuff and this was a good deal for good quality.
customer_reviews.author: L. AL azzawi

product_meta.title: Wilton Round Silicone Shot Glass Mold, 8-Cavity
product_meta.description: Package Quantity:1Add a unique flair to your next party with shot glasses molded from chocolate, candy, gelatin or ice. Hot chocolate tastes even better in a molded chocolate shot glass, or serve liquor shots in a cool ice glass. Simply fill, freeze, and invert silicone molds to release.
feature_bullets: Add a unique flair to your next party with shot glasses molded from chocolate, candy, gelatin or ice. Hot chocolate tastes even better in a molded chocolate shot glass, or serve liquor shots in a cool ice glass. Simply fill, freeze, and invert silicone molds to release.

Add a unique flair to your next party with shot glasses molded from chocolate, candy, gelatin or ice. Hot chocolate tastes even better in a molded chocolate shot glass, or serve liquor shots in a cool ice glass. Simply fill, freeze, and invert silicone molds to release
Make innovative shot glasses from chocolate, candy, ice or crisped rice treats
Mold dimensions: 10.4 x 2.46 in. (26.5 x 6.25 cm), Cavity dimensions: 1.77 dia. x 2.2 in. (4.5 dia. x 5.6 cm)
Dishwasher safe; wash before first and after each use
